image.altText: Amna smiles with the red desert behind her.

props.synopsis: Being in the middle of nowhere, you learn what really matters. You find yourself experiencing things with unbridled passion, without shame or second-guessing.

title.children: Moving to the outback gave me courage to do things I never dreamed of

image.altText: a bushfire at night, with the whole scene lit up red, sparks flying.

props.synopsis: Last month nearly 8 million hectares were burnt in the Northern Territory, an area bigger than the entire state of Tasmania.

title.children: Eight million hectares burnt during record hot October

image.altText: A pile of groceries alongside a cardboard box that reads: FOOD BANK

props.synopsis: A new report from Foodbank finds 20 per cent of Australian households have skipped meals or whole days of eating in the year up to July 2025.

title.children: One in five Australian households are 'severely food insecure', report finds

image.altText: A man looks at his award.

props.synopsis: From a dedicated doctor and a rubbish warrior, to a local hero who stopped a knife attack and helped fight Black Summer fires, the 2026 Northern Territory Australian of the Year awards are spotlighting local legends.

title.children: Doctor and dedicated volunteer named NT's Australian of the Year

image.altText: A close-up of a locked gate inside a prison.

props.synopsis: A 56-year-old man was stripped naked, handcuffed and made to wear a spit hood after suffering a seizure inside prison, a coronial inquest into his death has heard.

title.children: Prisoner stripped naked, made to wear spit hood after seizure, court hears

image.altText: A man wearing sunglasses with glitter up their cheekbones.

props.synopsis: For the LGBTQIA+ community, queer pubs and clubs can be an oasis. But in some capital cities they are vanishing.

title.children: By the end of the year, three capital cities could have no queer clubs

image.altText: Dark grey clouds in the distance. Road to the right and grass, trees and hill to left.

props.synopsis: A severe thunderstorm brought down trees and cut power for several hours in Alice Springs.

title.children: Power restored after Alice Springs lashed by 'fierce' storm

image.altText: Aerial of processing facility surrounded by green grass

props.synopsis: The sale of Yeeda Pastoral Company, including the Kimberley Meat Company, to TLP4 Australian Holdings is now complete.

title.children: Northern abattoirs set to return after Yeeda sale

image.altText: A shadowed figure behind a fence.

props.synopsis: As incarceration rates continue to soar in the Northern Territory, experts say mental health reform in the justice system is crucial for improving community safety in the long term.

title.children: Doctors warn mental health reforms needed to keep children out of prison

image.altText: A pregnant woman standing alongside two mums holding their babies, all three women are wearing serious facial expressions.

props.synopsis: Women who have had traumatic birth experiences at Royal Darwin Hospital have gathered to share their stories and call for urgent action from the territory and federal governments.

title.children: Ward crowding amplifies trauma for mothers whose babies 'gone too soon'

image.altText: Ben Andersonn with a black tshirt and black cap pats his dog on while sitting in the frame of a tiny home.

props.synopsis: Public interest in tiny homes has skyrocketed in recent years, but experts warn they come with their own problems.

title.children: Are tiny homes the solution to Australia's housing crisis?

image.altText: A large group of kayakers on the water, looking on at a massive coal bulk carrier.

props.synopsis: A Hunter Valley businessman is demanding recompense after the cancellation of a second cruise liner's visit to Newcastle amid safety fears sparked by a planned climate change protest on the harbour.

title.children: Furious businessman demands compensation from climate activists

image.altText: An older man sits in a hospital bed with a tube in his nose.

props.synopsis: Families and insiders say the system to assess people for aged care is in crisis, with 116,000 people on the waiting list. Once approved, they join the queue to get a home care package, which stands at more than 120,000.

title.children: Older Australians must now queue to join the queue for home care

image.altText: two players, Callum Ah Chee and Lachie Neale hug on the footy field after a winning goal..

props.synopsis: Australia's race discrimination commissioner says the AFL is falling far short of its responsibility to combat "horrific racism" aimed at its players.

title.children: 'You're nowhere near': Scathing message for AFL CEO on racism

image.altText: Josh Giddey throws a left-handed pass past Joel Embiid.

props.synopsis: Australia's Josh Giddey becomes the first Bulls player to record back-to-back triple doubles since Michael Jordan in 1989 as the Bulls continue their fast start to the NBA season.

title.children: Giddey joins Jordan in recording 36-year first in epic Bulls comeback

image.altText: A thick plume of black smoke rising above an airplane

props.synopsis: A UPS cargo plane with three people on board crashes after exploding during take-off from Louisville International Airport in the US state of Kentucky.

title.children: At least seven dead after cargo plane crashes in Kentucky

image.altText: Prince William and Princess Catherine turn around to look at Prince Andrew

props.synopsis: King Charles III's move to strip Andrew of all his titles and boot him out of his sprawling Windsor Park palace was a defining moment, but some say the former prince is getting off too lightly.

title.children: Andrew's exile isn't enough for some critics. Here's what could come next

image.altText: A crashed car outside a hospital

props.synopsis: NSW Ambulance paramedics treated a 47-year-old man and a 24-year-old woman, who are Concord Hospital employees.

title.children: Workers fight for life after car runs them down outside Sydney hospital

image.altText: Graphic with a lightbulb, logo of Temu, Commbank and HCF on a dynamic blue background.

props.synopsis: Five companies have been handed the infamous annual award by consumer group Choice, in a bid to name and shame "dodgy products, services and companies".

title.children: The five 'shonkiest' products and companies named at Choice awards

image.altText: An Asian Giant Hornet wearing a tracking device

props.synopsis: An American teacher and his teenage son die after being stung more than 100 times by a swarm of hornets while climbing down a tree after zip-lining at a resort in Laos.

title.children: Father and son killed by 'murder hornets' during Laos holiday

image.altText: Max Dowman applauds while looking up at the crowd after an Arsenal game

props.synopsis: At 15 years and 308 days old, Arsenal winger Max Dowman comes on as a sub against Slavia Prague to become the youngest player in Champions League history.

title.children: Arsenal 15yo becomes Champions League's youngest ever player

image.altText: Jake Weatherald holds his helmet and bat in celebration

props.synopsis: Australia has named its squad for the first Ashes Test, but is no closer to knowing who will open the batting in Perth on November 21.

title.children: Australia keeps opening mystery alive with 15-man Ashes squad

image.altText: A penguin flaps its wings on the sand at Gabo Island

props.synopsis: A re-establishing little penguin colony, once locally extinct, is finding its feet on the NSW far south coast.

title.children: World's smallest penguins return to coastal hamlet after 30-year disappearance

image.altText: Harriet Dyer with a clapper board and Patrick Brammall holding a dog (Colin) standing outside on the street

props.synopsis: On Tuesday, Arts Minister Tony Burke proposed a requirement for 10 per cent of streaming services' local expenditure to be spent on Australian film and TV. Here's what the industry thinks.

title.children: Streaming services respond to proposed 10pc Australian content quota

image.altText: Ley walks through a corridor, surrounded by cameras and reporters.

props.synopsis: The opposition leader has sought to hose down speculation she will soon be toppled, saying she is "completely confident" she will still be in the job at the end of the year.

title.children: Sussan Ley confronts leadership coup speculation head-on

image.altText: A weather radar being displayed on a phone, in front of a different radar on a computer screen

props.synopsis: Tender documents and sources show the Bureau of Meteorology's new website may have cost between $78m and $150m â€” much higher than initially reported.

title.children: BOM website questions intensify over true cost of redesign

image.altText: A group of police crowd around a white ute which has slammed into a wall in a food court.

props.synopsis: Tasmania Police says a woman has been seriously injured after a car crashed into a food court in Launceston's CBD.

title.children: Woman seriously injured after car ploughs into Launceston food court

image.altText: Two people on a motion-blurred city street with a temple and spire. Overlay "Race Around the World"

props.synopsis: Cult '90s show Race Around the World is back, and we're on the hunt for fearless storytellers! Got a passport, an epic sense of adventure and an eye for a story? We want to hear from you.

title.children: This career-making travel show is making a comeback and casting is open

image.altText: Vincent Tarzia is dressed in a suit and leaning against a brick wall

props.synopsis: South Australia's Liberal party says it will phase out stamp duty by 2041, if elected in March, but the premier has labelled the promise as "one of the most reckless, dangerous policy announcements" he has ever seen.

title.children: SA Liberals to abolish stamp duty if elected, premier slams 'reckless' policy

image.altText: ASIO director-general Mike Burgess delivering a speech.

props.synopsis: The nation's top spy uses a major speech to warn there is a "realistic possibility" a foreign government will try to assassinate a dissident on Australian soil, saying ASIO believes "at least three" nations are willing and capable of carrying out such a plot.

title.children: At least three nations 'willing to kill' on Australian soil, spy chief says

image.altText: Elon Musk holding his hands up to his mouth.

props.synopsis: Norway's sovereign wealth fund says it will vote against ratifying Tesla chief executive Elon Musk's proposed compensation package, which is potentially worth $US1 trillion.

title.children: Major Tesla shareholder to vote against Musk's $1.5 trillion pay deal

image.altText: Three detectives walk a man out of a house.

props.synopsis: Former NRL star Trent Merrin is arrested in the Illawarra, accused of stealing $140,000 in cryptocurrency.

title.children: Former Dragons and Panthers NRL star charged with crypto theft

image.altText: Sophie McKay of the Blues with father, Andrew McKay during the 2025 AFLW Round 01 match.

props.synopsis: Despite coming from a family with a strong pedigree for football, one of the AFLW's best new talents almost gave it up. Now, she is enjoying putting on a show.

title.children: Sophie comes from a famous football family. Yet she almost didn't play

image.altText: A dead fish with a gaping mouth

props.synopsis:
Scientists believe they have identified the species responsible for the toxins in South Australia's marine algal bloom that has killed millions of aquatic animals.
Â

title.children: Scientists hopeful they have found source of SA algal bloom toxins

image.altText: A group of Norwegians playing the accordion.

props.synopsis: Norway struck oil in the 1960s. Now, almost a quarter of its national budget is funded through its sovereign wealth fund. How does Australia compare with taxing its resources?

title.children: Norway struck oil in the 60s. Now it has trillions. Here's how Australia compares
